page.title: 01Tetchill,Hordley & Frankton
page.content: The area consists of three hamlets of widely differing characteristics. Tetchill is the largest of the three and,while it has some old buildings,it consists mostly of newer bungalows and houses.These include a small close of brick council houses. Hordley is a more traditional hamlet consisting of old buildings built from stone or bricks and timber. Lower Frankton is centred on the old canal junction and most buildings date from when this was an important route centre. No services remain from this bygone era and all houses are now residential. Most of these are very small cottages and many have been extended with varying degrees of sympathy for the original building. Outside the hamlets can be found a series of isolated farmsteads spaced at approximately 300m. intervals.
